channel.title: Geometry Help!
channel.description:
So, I'm taking geometry and I need some help with proofs. I'm supposed to find the reasons from the statements. I'll post the problem and what I've got(Not sure if it's correct): [hr]
Statements Reasons 1) m∠1 = m∠3 Given 2) ∠1 and ∠2 are vertical angles Vertical angle theorem 3) ∠1 ≅ ∠2 ______ 4) m∠1 = m∠2 definition of congruent angles 5) m∠2 = m∠3 ______ 6) ∠2 ≅ ∠3 ______

item.title: Geometry Help!
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“l, post:5, topic:463830”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=567513.msg4123111#msg4123111 date=1350004240]
We just finished going over these lol

  1. Definition of vertical angles
  2. Transitive property of equality? (Might need to check that for yourself, its something close to that)
  3. Definition of congruent angles
    [/quote]

This is the correct one.[/quote]
Heh heh, read the date next time

Read full topic

item.title: Geometry Help!
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Oh god I hated these. They only showed up on one unit and I didn’t see them again until trig, where they got much much harder. While I don’t know the answer, this should help:

http://www.regentsprep.org/Regents/math/geometry/GPB/theorems.htm

Read full topic

item.title: Geometry Help!
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

So, I’m taking geometry and I need some help with proofs. I’m supposed to find the reasons from the statements. I’ll post the problem and what I’ve got(Not sure if it’s correct):
[hr]

Statements Reasons

  1. m∠1 = m∠3 Given
  2. ∠1 and ∠2 are vertical angles Vertical angle theorem
  3. ∠1 ≅ ∠2 ______
  4. m∠1 = m∠2 definition of congruent angles
  5. m∠2 = m∠3 ______
  6. ∠2 ≅ ∠3 ______

Read full topic
